paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: Does TRAPPIST-1 b retain an atmosphere despite strong stellar irradiation?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Observed system
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Phase-resolved thermal spectra of TRAPPIST-1 b obtained with JWST MIRI.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Null scenario
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Bare-rock, no-atmosphere model with minimal heat redistribution.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich atmosphere scenario
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere model with significant CO2 absorption and greenhouse effect.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich atmosphere scenario
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Oxidized composition scenario with weaker CO2 signature constraints.

major_limitations: Single-planet study does not represent atmospheric prevalence across M-dwarf rocky planets.
Retrieval assumptions about circulation, opacity priors, and cloud treatment affect quantitative posteriors.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features.
